My question s=
hould be simple: Can I extract the number of moles of
each of the two phase=
s in the mixture? What would be the syntax for this?

I assumed it would be=
 possible by a command similar to
mix.temperature(), which returns the temp=
erature of the mixture but it
doesn't seem to be that easy.

Any help would=
 be much appreciated!

Below is the script I am using to produce the mixtur=
e:
 
from Cantera import*
Temp =3D 273.16
press =3D 1*OneAtm


phase=3DIdea=
lGasMix('NG5.cti')
water =3D importPhase('water.xml','liquid_water')

mix_p=
hases =3D [ (phase, 1.0), (water, 0.0)]
nsp=3Dphase.nSpecies()

phase.set(T=
 =3D Temp, P =3D press)
mix=3DMixture(mix_phases)
mix.setTemperature(Temp)
=
mix.setPressure(press)


mix.equilibrate("TP", err =3D 1.0e-3, maxsteps =3D=
 20000, maxiter =3D 5000,
loglevel =3D 0)
print mix
